result.execSummary:
Samuel B Jackson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Samuel B Jackson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel B Jackson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel B Jackson not in court.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Sandra Campbell.
Extradited to requesting state.
BTC: dismissed

Defendant Samuel B Jackson in court with attorney Erin J. Larsen.  Defendant Samuel B Jackson in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant.

BTC:  The court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly, & intelligently waives extradition.  Orders signed.  Control date set.  If the defendant has been extradited, Ms. Larsen gives the Court permission to call the case without her being present  Review hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
